Hound_SwA.synopsis: The players encounters Ketheric's undead hound in his chambers while sneaking around the tower. She's territorial - but if she smells Isobel's blessing on us she'll recognise Selunite magic. She reveals that she misses the way her master used to be.
Hound_SwA.how_to_trigger: Walk into Ketherics room and get spotted by the hound (-167; 37; -172).

AD_Patrol.synopsis: Squire patrols Ketheric room, making sure no trouble makers come poking around where they shouldn't. All sounds are animals noises - no VO!
AD_Patrol.how_to_trigger: Load SCL_Main_Agoto -177; 37; -187oe executiondoneWait outside Ketheric's room

AD_Bark.synopsis: The player entered combat with Ketheric's Hound on the upper floor of Moonrise (most likely within Ketheric's room). The hound barks to call one of the scrying eyes over to their location.
AD_Bark.how_to_trigger: Go to Moonrise Toweroe executiondoneGo to Ketheric's room (-167; 37; -172)Be spotted by the HoundLeave dialog to enter combat

automatic_ordering.reasoning: There are a couple of relations between these sessions. First, the 'AD_Patrol' session is triggered when the player remains outside Ketheric’s room (loading SCL_Main_Agoto and waiting), whereas the 'Hound_SwA' session happens when the player enters Ketheric’s room and gets spotted by the hound. This makes 'AD_Patrol' mutually exclusive with any session where the player actually enters the room, thereby excluding both 'Hound_SwA' and any session that might follow from that encounter. Second, once the player has encountered the hound in 'Hound_SwA', if they choose to fight the hound the situation escalates into a combat encounter, triggering the 'AD_Bark' session. In this sense, 'Hound_SwA' is a prerequisite for 'AD_Bark' because the encounter (the cause) precedes the combat (the consequence).

Hound_SwA_7.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_7.text: Stand, soldier! These are the General's private quarters.

Hound_SwA_45.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_45.text: ...Wait. Something in your scent is... familiar.

Hound_SwA_77.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_77.text: I'm just exploring the tower. I mean no harm.

Hound_SwA_4.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_4.text: You stumble into trouble like a stray pup. My own litter were the same.

Hound_SwA_33.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_33.text: But they are long dead, now. Mind where you stray, lest I send you to join them.

Hound_SwA_25.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_25.text: I cannot tell if your stink is lies or stupidity. It doesn't matter.

Hound_SwA_23.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_23.text: Ugh. The General has led many soldiers - and your form is by far the sloppiest.

Hound_SwA_40.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_40.text: Just be about your task then - whatever it is.

Hound_SwA_83.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_83.text: ...I do not know which army you fight for, but it is not my master's.
Hound_SwA_83.context: NodeContext: nonplussed at our terrible salute, attacks

Hound_SwA_94.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_94.text: Down, lapdog. A True Soul walks where they please.

Hound_SwA_80.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_80.text: ...Hmph. Walk carefully, then. Or I will learn exactly what True Soul tastes like.
Hound_SwA_80.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but giving a parting shot

Hound_SwA_90.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_90.text: You will not walk out again.

Hound_SwA_56.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_56.text: Stay still and let her smell you.

Hound_SwA_27.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_27.text: I do not know your face, but your scent... Selûnite magic. It used to fill these halls, back when I was flesh.

Hound_SwA_62.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_62.text: Since my master brought me back... this place smells wrong. His family is gone, replaced by bootlickers and beasts.

Hound_SwA_79.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_79.text: You are neither. So tell me true - what is your purpose here?

Hound_SwA_58.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_58.text: To serve Ketheric - as loyally as you do.

Hound_SwA_84.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_84.text: Good. Death itself cannot release you from that duty. Now be about your business, whatever it is.

Hound_SwA_18.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_18.text: My scent seemed to trigger a memory in you. What was it?

Hound_SwA_87.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_87.text: Not your scent - Selûnite magic on your skin. The General once smelled that way, when his daughter still lived.

Hound_SwA_42.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_42.text: I... died the same night she did, my master says. Trying to protect her. I do not remember.

Hound_SwA_9.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_9.text: But he brought me back. I will not fail him again.

Hound_SwA_30.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_30.text: Your scent is familiar to me, stranger - but I can still smell the lies underneath.

Hound_SwA_78.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_78.text: I only want to stop the Absolute.

Hound_SwA_41.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_41.text: I protect my master. What becomes of his master, I care not.

Hound_SwA_54.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_54.text: My scent seemed to trigger a memory in you. What was it?

Hound_SwA_21.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_21.text: Pass, then. But I will be watching.

Hound_SwA_14.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_14.text: Your master's beyond saving. I'm here to end him.

Hound_SwA_69.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_69.text: No! He may have changed, but he is still my master. I cannot let you pass.

Hound_SwA_64.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_64.text: To make sure your master dies. Screaming, preferably.

Hound_SwA_68.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_68.text: There will be no screams from you, stranger - not when I take your throat.

Hound_SwA_60.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_60.text: Do you take me for a teething pup? Get that out of my face.

Hound_SwA_36.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_36.text: Though whichever whelp owns that thing smells... happy. Safe. I have not scented such a thing since I was flesh.
Hound_SwA_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hesitates and cocks her head, sniffing the air.NodeContext: She hesitates and cocks her head, sniffing the air.

Hound_SwA_0.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_0.text: I'm a friend - I have some food to share.

Hound_SwA_49.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_49.text: I've had no stomach to fill for some time. But you will find my teeth are still sharp, stranger.

Hound_SwA_92.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_92.text: Gently reach out to pet the hound.

Hound_SwA_81.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_81.text: *Warily, it watches you approach. There's no flesh or fur to scratch at, only bone and cold metal...*

Hound_SwA_8.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_8.text: *...but it seems the touch is enough, and for a moment the undead beast is just another dog happily wagging its tail.*
Hound_SwA_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Re-use animation from player petting Scratch at camp.

Hound_SwA_44.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_44.text: I let you pass. Do not make me change my mind.

Hound_SwA_48.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_48.text: *Even stripped of flesh, the war-hound is formidable. Spectral eyes meet yours as it growls a challenge.*

Hound_SwA_13.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_13.text: *And then it hesitates, gleaming muzzle sampling your scent as if in... recognition?*

Hound_SwA_15.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_15.text: Lower your eyes - you're no threat.

Hound_SwA_74.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_74.text: *The hound relaxes, clearly accustomed to this show of deference within its master's chamber.*

Hound_SwA_6.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_6.text: *The growl only deepens. The hound isn't reassured - or perhaps it is simply taking no chances.*

Hound_SwA_39.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_39.text: *The dog relaxes, as if reassured by your observance of protocol.*

Hound_SwA_22.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_22.text: *It turns away and utterly ignores you - as it would any lowly foot soldier.*

Hound_SwA_75.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_75.text: *Perhaps your form was sloppy. Or perhaps the creature simply wants to taste your blood.*

Hound_SwA_11.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_11.text: It's a trained army hound - give it your best salute.

Hound_SwA_16.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_16.text: Give the creature a snarl of your own.

Hound_SwA_51.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_51.text: *This is not a creature easily cowed, but something in your display gives it pause.*

Hound_SwA_52.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_52.text: *The growl withers to a whimper, and the hound turns away, sheepish.*

Hound_SwA_46.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_46.text: Snarl at the beast's display of weakness.

Hound_SwA_38.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_38.text: Stay still and let it sniff you.

Hound_SwA_28.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_28.text: *Suspicious, the creature leans in for another sniff - and for a moment, its tail wags as if remembering a scent from long ago.*

Hound_SwA_71.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_71.text: *Then the beast shakes its head, a ferocious war-hound once more. Though perhaps not quite as ferocious as before.*

Hound_SwA_85.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_85.text: *Scratch's scent lies heavy on the toy - the scent of play, comfort, safety. For a moment, the skeletal tail twitches.*

Hound_SwA_10.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_10.text: Offer up some food from your pack.

Hound_SwA_88.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA_88.text: *The dog's growl only deepens, echoing in the cavity where its stomach used to be.*

Hound_SwA_31.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_31.text: You seemed to know my scent. How?

Hound_SwA_32.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA_32.text: Would it be all right if I gave you a scratch?

Hound_SwA_65.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_65.text: You'd be the first of the General's soldiers brave enough to try.

Hound_SwA_73.speaker: Squire
Hound_SwA_73.text: Hm. Hmmm... All right, that's enough.
Hound_SwA_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Re-use animation from player petting Scratch at camp.

AD_Bark_0.speaker: Squire
AD_Bark_0.context: NodeContext: Calling guards down on us
